alert.note: Alert for Boulder And Jefferson Counties Below 6000 Feet, West Broomfield County; Jefferson and West Douglas Counties Above 6000 Feet, Gilpin, Clear Creek, Northeast Park Counties Below 9000 Feet; North Douglas County Below 6000 Feet, Denver, West Adams and Arapahoe Counties, East Broomfield County (Colorado) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued May 04 at 3:11PM MDT by NWS Boulder
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of north central Douglas, southwestern Arapahoe, southwestern Denver and central Jefferson Counties through 400 PM MDT... At 310 PM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 5 miles north of South Platte, or 20 miles southwest of Denver, moving northeast at 30 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Southwestern Denver, southern Lakewood, southwestern Centennial, Highlands Ranch, Littleton, Englewood, Greenwood Village, Lone Tree, Roxborough Park, Sheridan, Morrison, Louviers, Conifer, South Platte, Pine Junction, Tiny Town, Chatfield Reservoir, Buffalo Creek, Aspen Park and Indian Hills. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: Prepare for sudden gusty winds. Secure loose objects and move to a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle. If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.

area.areaDesc: Boulder And Jefferson Counties Below 6000 Feet, West Broomfield County; Jefferson and West Douglas Counties Above 6000 Feet, Gilpin, Clear Creek, Northeast Park Counties Below 9000 Feet; North Douglas County Below 6000 Feet, Denver, West Adams and Arapahoe Counties, East Broomfield County
